title: Reflation Trade Will Drive Markets For Next Year: Tribeca's Liu
text: Jan.17 -- Jun Bei Liu, portfolio manager at Tribeca Investment Partners, discusses her outlook for markets in 2021. She speaks on “Bloomberg Daybreak: Asia.

title: Vaccine distribution will be key driver of S&P 500 upside in 2021, strategist says
text: John Stoltzfus of Oppenheimer Asset Management believes that the current record high level of the S&P 500 index has much more room for growth, as confidence rises with more vaccinations and the U.S. economy reopens.

title: Pro: Don't count on Nasdaq's outperformance to continue in 2021
text: The tech-dominated Nasdaq index soared more than 40% in 2020 and investors expecting more of the same in 2021 may need to revisit their thesis, BK Asset Management Managing Director of FX Strategy Boris Schlossberg wrote in a CNBC op-ed. What happened in 2020?

title: Forecasts Of 2021 Stock Market Performance Are Overly Optimistic
text: Two basic underlying assumptions are uniformly optimistic. Threats to the economy and stock market are rarely discussed or reflected in forecasts.

title: How to Prepare for an Inflation Spike in 2021
text: Inflation is one of the most important macroeconomic indicators for investors. It is also one of the primary inputs used by policymakers – both fiscal and monetary.

title: Bought The Rumor, Selling The News
text: This is a weekly series focused on analyzing the previous week's economic data releases. The objective is to concentrate on leading indicators of economic activity to determine whether the economy is strengthening or weakening, and the rate of inflation is increasing or decreasing.

title: Netflix, Goldman Sachs, Intel, Bank of America, and Other Stocks to Watch This Week
text: Fourth-quarter earnings season continues with results from Goldman Sachs, Morgan Stanley, Netflix, IBM, Intel, Procter & Gamble, and United Airlines. Plus, Biden inauguration and ECB and BoJ decisions.

title: Weekly Commentary: The Reality Of Financial Dominance
text: Weekly Commentary: The Reality Of Financial Dominance

title: Why REITs Beat Real Estate Crowdfunding Sites
text: Most investors understand that they should invest in real estate, but don't know what's the best vehicle. In the recent years, crowdfunding sites have grown in popularity.

title: Where the Market Goes Next
text: Two weeks into 2021, and the S&P is flat — up just 0.5% as I write, as the market searches for direction. Part of the challenge is the litany of unknowns before us today … Will President-elect Biden's inauguration go off without disruption or will there be more violence like we saw at the Capitol.

title: The wealthy are investing like a market bubble is here, or at least near
text: A majority of millionaire investors say a stock bubble is occurring, but their market risk appetite is still going up, with a shift in portfolio strategy.

title: Calm Before The Stock Storm
text: Excessive speculation is among the major drivers of the rally. Behavioral and technical indicators signal a reversal within the next few weeks.

title: Op-ed: The easiest trade in the market will come to an end in 2021
text: For four years, the easiest trade in the world has been to buy the Nasdaq. That could be about to change, argues BK Asset Management's Boris Schlossberg.

title: Political chaos won't make a dent in the market. Here's why
text: The market set a new record even as rioters storming the Capitol shocked the nation. Stock history shows extremes in politics don't often shake investors.

title: Corporate earnings don't look great. But the drought may be over soon
text: It's report card season for Corporate America. Companies are starting to release their earnings for the fourth quarter of last year, and so far it doesn't look like many blue chip stocks are going to get a passing grade. There's good news though: 2021 is likely to be a lot better.

title: Actionable Ideas to Start the New Year
text: This article is relevant to financial professionals who are considering offering Model Portfolios to their clients. If you are an individual investor interested in WisdomTree ETF Model Portfolios, please inquire with your financial professional.

title: Earnings Watch: The COVID-19 earnings recession is expected to remain, but an end may be in sight
text: After the holiday quarter snapped an earnings recession last year, the same is not expected this year --- but it isn't impossible, and may happen three months later.

title: Dividend Boosts Lift REITs
text: U.S. equity markets finished mostly lower this past week as partisan tensions raged on while economic data and corporate earnings reports indicated that the U.S. economy stumbled into the start of 2021. The S&P 500 retreated 1.5% while the tech-heavy Nasdaq dipped more than 2% amid pressure on social media stocks following the de-platforming of President Trump and conservative-leaning media outlets.

title: Cryptocurrencies and SPACs show signs of 'irrational exuberance,' but the stock market is not in a bubble, says UBS
text: While many parts of the market are showing signs of  "irrational exuberance" that should alarm some investors, UBS's Mark Haefele says there are still some risk assets outside of bubble territory. "All of the bubble preconditions are in place," he explained in a Friday note, citing record low financing costs, new participants entering into the market, and a combination of historically low interest rates and high savings rates from government stimulus that's left investors who are searching for returns with no alternative but equities.

title: Weighing The Week Ahead: What Do The Biden Proposals Mean For Investors
text: Last week's data had a touch of good economic news and a strong start to earnings season. There is a light calendar and a holiday-shortened week, but some important earnings reports.

title: US small-cap stocks have raced ahead of their bigger peers in 2021. Experts say a number of factors could send them higher.
text: The stock market recovery from the coronavirus crash in the spring of 2020 was all about the biggest US names: Amazon, Apple, Facebook, Google, and Netflix. But the smaller, more unloved parts of the stock market come roaring back in the autumn and winter, and their momentum has continued in 2021. The Russell 2000 index of small-capitalization stocks has jumped 1.5%, for example.

title: A Historic Margin Call Could Bring The Next Stock Market Crash Despite Low Interest Rates
text: No one can time the market, yet there are indicators that signal very strongly that we are in for a severe correction or even a crash. Some investors are still partying. But special care is now required when selecting stocks.

title: Week 3 MDA Breakout Stocks - January 2021: Short-Term Picks To Give You An Edge
text: Two new breakout stocks for Week 2 of 2021 with better than 10% short-term upside potential. This past week all 4 stocks gained over 10% during the week led by top gains in CRNT +112.1%, FTEK +29.3%, NIU +22.7% with the avg closing gain +22.1%.
